page.title: 02THE CORNISH HEDGE
page.content: We looked at a section of a typically {Cornish hedge}an earth bank with small trees on top.The hedge faces west and measured about 20 metres.We made a diary of flowers found in the hedge over a period of eight weeks,beginning 8th May.The hedge has not been cut since last Autumn.After six weeks of looking at our hedge we have found twenty-nine different flowers.(Two weeks later it was thirty-two).Some flowers have been in the hedge every week,some for only a short time.Blue bells were in the hedge for only two weeks.At first most of the flowers were yellow;now they are yellow,red,white,blue and some are even green,like sorrel and wall penny-wort.
